results.title: Man with a Movie Camera
results.brief_description: A cameraman wanders around Moscow, Kharkov, Kiev and Odessa with a camera slung over his shoulder, documenting urban life with dazzling invention.

constellations_primary.name: Film-truth
constellations_primary.description: The experimental documentary Man with a Movie Camera has had a lasting impact on the development of film styles.

results.title: Man who chooses the bush
results.creator_credit: Tom Radford, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For five or six months at a time Frank Ladouceur lives alone, trapping muskrat in the vast, desolate wilderness of northern Alberta. His family last visited him there some fourteen years ago, and Frank’s own visits to the family home in Fort Chipewyan are few and far between. This is the story of an independent Metis who is remarkably determined and self-sufficient, and who is ceaselessly called to return to the bush.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Radford, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Man who bypassed death
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Follows John Duffy through open heart surgery. Without the surgery he would have died within the year. The multiple by-pass operation now-a-days has a low failure rate, but it is still a frightening experience. Duffy and his doctor share their doubts and fears through each stage in the procedure.

results.title: Man to man
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Mental Health Film Board and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: A recruitment and orientation film depicting a psychiatric aide’s realisation, in his daily contact with the mental patients under his care, that his work has a therapeutic function, and that he is more than just an attendant hired to take care of the elementary physical needs of his patients. Emphasises teamwork between himself, the psychiatrist, psychiatric social worker, and nurse, and on the meaningfulness of play therapy when coupled with psychotherapy.

results.title: Man the manager
results.brief_description: Designed to increase employee pride and identification with the organisation. Illustrates methods of integrating the employee, increasing their understanding of their job and skill in performing it. Case histories show three situations in which failure to follow management principles had a detrimental effect on the organisation.

results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES

results.title: Man the builder
results.creator_credit: George Klein and Audio Visual Education Centre, South Australia
results.brief_description: By simple animation the film tells of the human need for shelter. At first we existed in caves, then in holes underground with a parallel development from hunting wild animals for food to primitive agriculture. This led to the establishment of village life and the hunting tribe developed into the stable community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Klein and Audio Visual Education Centre, South Australia

results.title: Man Ray films
results.creator_credit: Man Ray and Centre Georges Pompidou
results.brief_description: Man Ray, born as Emmanuel Radnitzky in 1890 in America, was primarily known as an avant-garde photographer achieving much critical acclaim for his work. He left America for Europe in 1921 where Man Ray constantly shifted in his use of mediums, drawing on the relationship between his disciplines of sculpture, painting, photography and cinema to further inform the content of his work. Although mostly known for his photographic work, it was his film work that was to remain central to his practise. Ray’s observations provoked by the use of different mediums informed his cinematic work and vice versa. This inventive and eclectic approach allowed him to discover the intrinsic qualities of light, “transgressing the limits of the ordinary”, and avoiding cliche whilst constantly reinventing his work. Man Ray didn’t like the popularist narrative represented in most films and preferred simply to bring the still life subjects of his photos and sculptures to life by putting them in a format that set them in motion. As well as 11 previously unreleased short ‘autobiographical’ films, this video contains the four films that brought Man Ray into notoriety as an avant-garde film maker: Le Retour a la Raison (which initially screened with Richter’s Rhythmus 21 and Charles Sheeler and Paul Strand’s Manhatta), Emak Bakia, L’Etoile de Mer and Les Mysteres du Chateau du de. All films contain what are now historical references to the 1920’s that serve to describe cubism, dadaism and surrealism. (For example, the cubist garden created by Gabriel Guevrekian with the surrounding furniture and sculptures being made by the artists of the day, musicians like Fats Waller and Leopold Stokowski (playing Erik Satie’s compositions) also feature amongst others.

results.title: Man proposes, God disposes
results.creator_credit: Sophia Selvakumar, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sophia Selvakumar first came to Australia, she missed her family so terribly she returned to India after 70 days. Eventually, she returned to Australia and set about making this country her new home.

results.title: Man on the rim series
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Anthony Buckley and Quantum Films
results.brief_description: Over two years in the making, this series about the Pacific Oceean, the people who live around it and across its vast expanse, has breathtaking photography and fascinating narration which illustrates that what we are learning about this area comes from the descendants of the original inhabitants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Raymond, Anthony Buckley and Quantum Films
